documents.document: Pleased to be at Danish Intensive Care Symposium in Hindsgavl. Looking forward to talking about #REACTORtrial #TEAMtrial and other stuff
#CCR17 is the best continuing medical education meeting there is. Next year it will sell out even faster @CritCareReviews
@iwashyna @kellumja may be right about 0.9% saline. Patients in #PLUStrial will receive an average of 10L+ of fluid so we will soon see...
@iwashyna @precordialthump most of the time it is easy to see the larynx with DL; how is this result surprising?
My #SMACC talk with @FlaviaSepsis on the top 10 ICU trials of the recent past now up on @I_C_N https://t.co/PxOLAfuY3S
@kennethbaillie @geoghep @iwashyna @icuresearch ...except that there is no truth in clinical trials (just degrees of probability)
An amazing 100 @WellingtonICU patients now enrolled in the #TARGETtrial
important work from @dfmcauley https://t.co/Ndl8aLUzEV
@geoghep @iwashyna @icuresearch it's not that physiology isn't important just that making the physiology better sometimes kills the patient.
#TARGETtrial from @ANZICS_CTG has 875 of 4000 enrolled including 402 in NZ and 99 from @WellingtonICU
All health professionals should read this one and think about what it says https://t.co/5YxAsUhodr
#TARGETtrial 834 of 4000 but the big news is that we expect to enrol patient 4000 in 2017 @ANZICS_CTG
Another nice piece making the case for the #PLUStrial https://t.co/Jri5uKYza4
The 21st Century Cures Act will be a disaster for healthcare throughout the developed world. Anecdote over evidence https://t.co/ttp6RfMUJS
@hswapnil @JeremyCohen14 not confirmed but I was thinking: The evidence base is fatally flawed. Pro: Ioannidis; Con: Me.
OMG what was I thinking. Debating EBM against John Ioannidis is going to be like arguing the existence of God withâ€¦ https://t.co/zd2cBSK0fO
The background work supporting the #TAMEtrial is one of the most highly cited papers in Resuscitation https://t.co/64SzobHBiq
The death of science & the rise of bias and anecdote. Link from @icuresearch https://t.co/clo6UheQ1w
#TEAMtrial has been funded by the NHMRC. Another great @ANZICS_CTG trial will happen!
#icssoa2017 I'll be there ðŸ˜Š
@JulianOwenEM @jlvincen if there is shock then either saline or a balanced crystalloid would be equally acceptable (2/2)
@JulianOwenEM @jlvincen unless hypotension/shock, I'll stick with my earlier answer. Low Na is hard data; clinically dry is not (1/2)
@JulianOwenEM @jlvincen Can I choose no fluid plus urgent dialysis? Low Na suggests water overload already.
#REACTORtrial protocol manuscript accepted today; same day as we enrolled our 1st patient
First patient in the world enrolled in the #REACTORtrial @WellingtonICU https://t.co/jwwLAXKM9T
@agordonICU @royalsocietynz @HRCNewZealand @ANZICS_CTG thanks Tony
@PeterWJHarrigan thanks peter
@karnikicu thanks
@ed_litton thanks Ed
@kdsoni111 thanks
@JuicyMango1 thanks
@anzic_rc thanks Carol
@stevemathieu75 thanks.
@NaomiHammond thanks
@adintheICU thanks Anthony
@icuresearch thanks Simon
Last night I received an award from @royalsocietynz @HRCNewZealand https://t.co/5gMS1txQ1w It was only possible because of the @ANZICS_CTG
#ICUROXtrial all the background information there is on O2 in critical illness from @precordialthump https://t.co/stqwHs22Va
And, in response to my previous tweet, someone unfollowed me so now I only have 1999 followers. Phew, now the pressure is off.
2000 followers and, yet, I often can't think of anything to say.
@iwashyna proper pre-publication peer review is, to quote @KathMaitland , a 'kind of dipstick for shit'
#REACTORtrial start up NZ meeting done. We are officially on the starting line @ANZICS_CTG
@icuresearch I read it but, I suppose, NZ is another country...
@horstie well ahead. Most sites come on line early 2017 & we now expect to be finished late 2017. #TARGETtrial
#TARGETtrial 623 out of 4000 enrolled @ANZICS_CTG
If it's not important, remember don't let perfect be the enemy of done. That way, you have time to make important stuff perfect.
#REACTORtrial start-up meeting in Wellington next week. Hoping to enrol the first patient very soon.
A great review that tells you all we know about paracetamol in critical illness https://t.co/lM27E7aNAL
front page of Wellington's paper https://t.co/dk72MY5zLd
@BellomoRinaldo not random so much as pointless.
#TARGETtrial 550 of 4000 enrolled; 75 from @WellingtonICU
Simple message: If the treatment effect is not biologically plausible, don't believe the result of the trial https://t.co/G6xH8pfQOr
I am not surprised that trials with very large treatment effects are usually bollocks https://t.co/G6xH8pfQOr
Recently I said hello to a patient on a ward round & they said "ROODLE ROODLE ROOOOOOOO...DLE!". #lifeimitatesart
@ercowboy nice one. We are a very powerful group of witches and wizards though.
#dasSMACC if you are interested in research the Dark Arts Workshop is a unique opportunity. Limited to 30. https://t.co/XW4NVSlWtO
Riding a bike from one side of Australia to the other is nuts but @ed_litton is a legend for doing it & I am enjoying his progress tweets.
"@medevidenceblog: @DogICUma prediction markets to predict replicability of trials. In Nature https://t.co/fGLuBDZgCe" interesting idea
@sg_anzics won't be finished by then so no secrets to share...
500th #TARGETtrial patient enrolled @WellingtonICU
@curatorius @precordialthump by writing you learn to write & build track record; once you have track record, your imagination is the limit.
@precordialthump depends which journal you write for ;)
#TARGETtrial 491 of 4000
@iamyourgasman @nitramsg @JAMA_current @WelshICS #ICUROXtrial being done by @ANZICS_CTG 100 of 1000 enrolled
@jasumback targeting a 'sick' group where it is reasonable to postulate cost of pyrexia outweighs benefit. Protocol manuscript coming soon.
How will we afford all these new cancer drugs @nejm
4 'mab' drugs for cancer that sort of work https://t.co/Tkaqwg8fO5 https://t.co/O0z8kr1Ztg https://t.co/IuaOpVcLCg https://t.co/L0XTsyx35E
If the hypotheses outlined in this paper are true the #REACTORtrial is going to be big news. https://t.co/9hFGJMZ1BC
@horstie the ICU should be a place where dogma is broken down.
@horstie @CritCareReviews @JAMA_current expect to publish mid 2018
"@dbootland: @DogICUma @stemlyns @JAMA_current 'a larger multi-centre trial is needed'.....sigh" #ICUROXtrial already recruiting
@iwashyna @anzic_rc @ANZICS_CTG @BellomoRinaldo we should hear about whether our funding application was successful very soon.
@geoghep 10% of #ICUROXtrial recruitment done (n=1000). Expect last patient in by end of 2017 and results published in 2018
https://t.co/XERrgKyyTH "We stopped early as suggested by a statistical reviewer after an interim analysis not defined a priori." Seriously?
Latest evidence on O2 in ICU https://t.co/iFc3wbFRvk 1. 1 centre; 2. Early stopping without stopping rules Better data coming #ICUROXtrial
@MedCrisis contact @oliflower he will sort it out.
#TARGETtrial 430 of 4000 enrolled including 205 from NZ
Pyrexia in the ICU. Nice series of articles in @Crit_Care https://t.co/is5pXOxGmF
#TARGETtrial 400 out of 4000 enrolled in our @ANZICS_CTG trial.
New Brain Trauma Foundation Guidelines. Summary=we know (almost) nothing but these are some things we made up https://t.co/TQt7T9XzsW
More data supporting the need to conduct the #PLUStrial https://t.co/pSRYvZUYe7
Managed to sneak a reference to #fragilityindex into @JAMA_current https://t.co/HO12JFimmC
Some comments on timing of RRT study from JAMA and why @akistarrt is a high priority https://t.co/HO12JFimmC
We have now enrolled 100 patients in the #ADRENALtrial in @WellingtonICU
@EmmaMerrynz @kaye_rolls @psirides mine was also a joke but I think I could put it off ;)
@kaye_rolls @EmmaMerrynz @psirides maybe not if the Dr said started by saying I have made a list of things we need to talk about today, OK?
Risk of unacceptable badness needs to be part of the conversation when deciding whether to do a decompressive crani. https://t.co/24TbhEFJbt
Can I print this out and take it with me to the meeting? https://t.co/Ztt8Ezk8JK
Great commentary on @RESCUEicp trial from @EMNerd_ https://t.co/VptsNmwhfI
@precordialthump the statement is true. It's just not the point...
@EMinFocus for every 100 treated with surg intent, 22 more survive ( 23% are vegetative, 18% are dependent; 59% are better than this)
@Menon_Cambridge do you have data on organ donor rates for the 2 groups. Seems to me very important to deciding 'best' Rx at societal level
@Menon_Cambridge totally agree that whether upper severe disability is a good outcome is complex and likely to depend on the individual
@scimedic I agree; people who need a minder to leave the house may still have good quality of life & this group is key to interpretation.
@JAMyburgh totally agree. The Rescue-ICP paper is beautifully written.
...plus Rx with medical intent likely to result in increased organ donor numbers & hence net societal benefit #RESCUEICP (2/2)
#RESCUEICP in refractory high ICP 2ndry to trauma Rx with medical intent gives same no. of truly independent survivors as decomp (1/2)
@Menon_Cambridge ...and assuming that you buy into the notion that being unable leave home without a minder is a good outcome
#rescueicp trial results are out and decompressive craniectomy for refractory ICP sucks https://t.co/czqbnHrudG
@Wilkinsonjonny not for this one, sorry.
